data.title: revised #568. abs and max.
data.body:
clipping the lighting result via ciel was causing banding issues with specular maps with alpha channels. rev2. also addresses the warning:

"warning X3571: pow(f, e) will not work for negative f, use abs(f) or conditionally handle negative values if you expect them" since it was coming from the same line, and included the comparable openGL entry

version one of this PR: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/586
better isolated and using templates

data.title: Add OpenGL 3.2 renderer

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Based on https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/dev_linux_opengl

For easy testing, check [https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/development_opengl](https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/development_opengl) a branch with T3D development + all OpenGL PRs

It's better review all PRs but not merge. We can add a comment `For merge` or `Aproved` and merge all at same time. We can track here the `Aproved` PRs.

Some code are very old, let me revise all work and add a bit of related information. I can mark as `Final Review` for we can focus our work.

It's desirable we merge as fast we can, for have time to resolve any future issue before Torque3D 3.7 release.

Separate in small PRs:
- [x] Use GFXDevice::setupGenericShaders for support non Fixed Fuction Pipelines. #608 
- [x] Add sampler names to Templates ShaderData declarations necesary for OpenGL. #611
- [x] Use shader data for get sampler register in CloudLayer and BasicClouds. #618 
- [x] Add RenderPassData::mSamplerNames for OpenGL code. Not used on DX9. #620 
- [x] Handle texel-pixel offset with diferents graphics APIs. #622 
- [x] Remove GFXDevice::disableShader. #924 
- [x] Add sampler names to ShaderData. #925 
- [x] Fix PrimBuild with non Fixed Function Pipeline. #926 
- [x] Add GFXDevice::setupGenericShader for fix render on non FFP. #927 
- [x] Change RenderParticleMgr for use sampler names #928 
- [x] Remove unnecesary code for handle OpenGL #929 
- [x] Separate OpenGL code from Linux or Mac. #930 
- [x] Set correct terrain layer texture format. #931 
- [x] Reduce innecesary changes on Render Target textures. #932 
- [x] Changes on ShaderGen for generate GLSL shaders. #933 
- [x] Changes on PostFX for OpenGL. #934 
- [x] Fix imposter capture on OpenGL. #935 
- [x] GLEW library for OpenGL. #936 
- [x] Increase FrameBuffer size for use on OpenGL. #937 
- [x] Remove old/unused OpenGL files. #938 
- [x] Templates changes for OpenGL shaders. #939 
- [x] Add/Activate OpenGL render. #940 
- [x] Merge all OpenGL PRs

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

see also: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/475

data.title: removed trailing spaces
data.body:
Removed trailing spaces from:
- *.cpp, *.h, *.c, *.hlsl, *.glsl, *.gui in the folder Engine/source and below
- *.cs, *.gui in the root folder and below

data.title: FMod plugin incorrectly handles events
data.body:
Two problems I have noted, as follows:

1) The SFXFMODEvent class makes use of `` `FMOD_Event_Release`. However the FMOD API docs clearly state the following regarding this function:

```
Note: This function is currently only for when you've specified >0 value for FMOD_EVENT_LOADINFO.sizeof_instancepool_simple.
```

Since Torque3D does not provide a FMOD_EVENT_LOADINFO struct when loading FMOD, I can only assume all calls to FMOD_Event_Release will effectively be redundant, leading to a memory leak. Instead `FMOD_EventGroup_FreeEventData` should be used.

2) SFXFMODEventSource::_updateStatus() does not always stop the source when an error has occured, leaving the source in a perpetual invalid state. This usually happens if fmod deletes the event instance. Since `FMOD_EVENT_STATE state;` is not initialized, the playing bit may or may not be set depending on what magic values have been left on the stack.

data.title: Memory corruption in FMod plugin
Revert trigger polyhedron change

data.title: pull #567 for official commit.
data.body:
After reviewing thoroughly this terrain patch (i'm segfault- on irc) and giving the op 
a recommandation, i think that once it's modified to work with unsigned integers
again, this would be a nice patch.

data.title: Bullet physics applyImpulse() fix
data.body: Bullet physics requires a local origin be passed into it's applyImpulse() rather than a world origin.

data.title: Fixed Box3F::overlap
data.body:
It was previously leaving the maximum extent of the overlap box uninitialised, and therefore was useless. Turns out this function isn't actually used in the codebase at all at the moment, so nothing is broken. It's just nice to have it working if it's there.

(Also, `Box3F::intersect` is incorrectly named. It actually performs a union. Just sayin'.)

data.title: Seamless terrain.
data.body:
Heights, sizes and materials on the edges of terrains are corrected.

Before patch (4 terrains)
![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/311074/1994033/62203cc4-84e5-11e3-8fdc-e396d80e1f1d.png)

After patch
![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/311074/1994039/6afc61ba-84e5-11e3-993b-c1c059e3f39e.png)

[Test level](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4G7HDT9STV-ZDFrUmg3eDd5eHc/edit?usp=sharing) (extract to the folder 'game/levels/test'). Smart run from the command line

> application.exe -level "test/seamless-terrain/test1.mis"
